Strings

isAlphaNum View Source

Tests if a character is a letter or a number.

Inputs

A

Character to test

Outputs

C

Set if the character is alphanumeric

itostr View Source

Converts an 32 bit unsigned integer into an ASCII-encoded decimal string.

Inputs

HL

String pointer

ACIX

Number

Notes

This will not have leading zeros and has a range of 0 to 4,294,967,295.

strchr View Source

Returns a pointer on the first occurence of a character in a string.

Inputs

B

Needle

HL

Haystack

Outputs

A

Destroyed

Z

Set if character found

HL

Pointer to first occurence of character

strcmp View Source

Determines if two strings are equal, and checks alphabetical sort order.

Inputs

DE

String pointer

HL

String pointer

Outputs

C

Set if string HL is alphabetically earlier than string DE

Z

Set if equal, reset if not equal

strcmp_sort View Source

Compares strings at ((HL)) and ((DE)). That is, calls indirect16HLDE, then calls strcmp.

Inputs

DE

Pointer to string pointer

HL

Pointer to string pointer

Outputs

C

Set if string (HL) is alphabetically earlier than string (DE)

Z

Set if equal, reset if not equal

Notes

This routine is useful as the callback for the callbackSort routine. It allows sorting a list of pointers to strings in alphabetical order.

strcpy View Source

Copies a string.

Inputs

DE

Destination

HL

String pointer

Notes

This will trample into undefined territory if you try to copy a string into some allocated memory it won't fit in.

strlen View Source

Determines the length of a zero delimited string.

Inputs

HL

String pointer

Outputs

BC

String length

strtoi View Source

Converts an ASCII-encoded signed decimal into a number.

Inputs

B

Maximum number of digits to convert

HL

Pointer on ASCII-encoded decimal

Outputs

DEHL

Converted word

Z

Set on success, reset on error

Notes

This will ignore leading zeros and has an unsigned range of 0 to 4,294,967,295. Signed numbers may be prefixed with '-' and have a range of -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647. Strings whose numbers fall outside that range produce undefined behavior.

toLower View Source

Converts every alpha character of a string to lowercase.

Inputs

HL

Pointer to string

Notes

This modifies the string in-place.

toUpper View Source

Converts every alpha character of a string to uppercase.

Inputs

HL

Pointer to string

Notes

This modifies the string in-place.
